title: Mark McNally (footballer)
text:
Mark McNally (born 10 March 1971) is a Scottish former <a href="Association%20football">footballer</a> who played in <a href="Defender%20%28association%20football%29">defence</a>, primarily as a centre-half although he also played occasionally at right-back.
Career.
Celtic to England.
McNally began his career with <a href="Celtic%20F.C.">Celtic</a> youths and progressed on to the first team, making his debut against <a href="Motherwell%20fc">Motherwell</a> in November 1990 in a 2–1 win. McNally went on to become a regular member of the Celtic first team for the next few seasons, making over 100 league appearances. He struggled for a place in the team during season 1994–95 under new manager <a href="Tommy%20Burns%20%28footballer%29">Tommy Burns</a>, but still won the <a href="Scottish%20Cup">Scottish Cup Final</a> in what transpired to be his final game for the club. After a very brief period on loan at <a href="Man%20City%20FC">Manchester City</a>, McNally was transferred to <a href="Southend%20United%20F.C.">Southend United</a> in December 1995 for £50,000. McNally made his debut for Southend United on 17 August 1996 against <a href="Tranmere%20Rovers%20F.C.">Tranmere Rovers</a>. McNally spent two seasons with Southend United making over fifty league appearances for the club before being transferred to <a href="Stoke%20City%20F.C.">Stoke City</a> for £120,000 in 1997. McNally made his debut for Stoke City on 31 March 1997 against <a href="Bradford%20City%20A.F.C.">Bradford City</a>. McNally was released by Stoke City at the end of the <a href="1997%E2%80%9398%20Stoke%20City%20F.C.%20season">1997–98 season</a> after making only seven appearances for the club.
Return to Scotland.
After McNally was released by Stoke City he returned to Scotland to join <a href="Dundee%20United%20F.C.">Dundee United</a> making his debut for the club against <a href="Kilmarnock%20F.C.">Kilmarnock</a> on 1 August 1998. In January 2000 McNally was placed on loan to <a href="Ayr%20United%20F.C.">Ayr United</a> until the end of the season. McNally made his debut for Ayr United on 12 February 2000 against <a href="Falkirk%20F.C.">Falkirk</a>. At the end on the 1999/2000 season McNally was released by Dundee United to enable him to sign up for <a href="Partick%20Thistle%20F.C.">Partick Thistle</a>. McNally made his debut for Partick on 7 October 2000. McNally was at Partick for a season, scoring once against <a href="Stranraer%20F.C.">Stranraer</a>, and was released despite being the fans player of the season. After being released by Partick Thistle, McNally was signed by <a href="Clydebank%20F.C.%20%281965%29">Clydebank</a> making his debut on 4 August 2001 against <a href="Forfar%20Athletic%20F.C.">Forfar Athletic</a>. McNally stayed at Clydebank until the club removed from both the <a href="Scottish%20Football%20League">Scottish Football League</a> and the <a href="Scottish%20Football%20Association">Scottish Football Association</a>. McNally went on to join former Partick Thistle teammate <a href="Allan%20Moore">Allan Moore</a> at <a href="Stirling%20Albion%20F.C.">Stirling Albion</a> where he made his debut against <a href="Albion%20Rovers%20F.C.">Albion Rovers</a> on 3 August 2002. McNally went on to make over 100 appearances for Stirling Albion and in 2005 McNally was appointed as <a href="Coach%20%28sports%29">Assistant manager</a>, McNally remained as a player with the club.
McNally left Stirling Albion at the end of the <a href="2007%E2%80%9308%20in%20Scottish%20football">2007–08 season</a> to join the <a href="Scottish%20Football%20Association">Scottish Football Association</a> as part of the youth coaching system.
Managerial career.
At the beginning of the 2007–08 season McNally started as a full-time Assistant Manager for Stirling Albion.
On 9 June 2010 he was appointed as <a href="Allan%20Moore">Allan Moore</a>'s assistant at <a href="Greenock%20Morton%20F.C.">Greenock Morton</a>. He and Moore were sacked on 23 November 2013 after a 5-1 home defeat to Livingston.
McNally has been a coach with <a href="Celtic%20F.C.%20Under-20s%20and%20Academy">Celtic's youth academy</a> since 2013.
